meanings.sent1: The car passed the red traffic light quickly.
meanings.sent2: I passed by the park on my way to school.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit passed the tortoise in the race.
meanings.sent4: Time passed like a river flowing steadily.
meanings.sent5: The wind passed through the open window, carrying the scent of flowers.

meanings.sent1: She passed the ball to her teammate during the game.
meanings.sent2: I passed the book to my friend after finishing it.
meanings.sent3: The magician passed the wand to the audience member.
meanings.sent4: The torch was passed from runner to runner in the relay race.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of passing down family recipes continued for generations.

meanings.definition: Succeeded in an exam or test
meanings.sent1: He passed the math test with flying colors.
meanings.sent2: She passed her driving exam on the first try.
meanings.sent3: The student passed the quiz despite not studying.
meanings.sent4: The team passed the final challenge to win the competition.
meanings.sent5: After hours of studying, she finally passed the difficult exam.
